intro: Ranunculus gautieri, commonly known as the Persian buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with prominent white花瓣. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it tolerates cold temperatures and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
